description: LSP-aware hooks for code quality validation, persistent memory, and agent team coordination

hooks.prompt: Before stopping, verify the task is complete: all requested changes made, no pending todos, and code compiles without errors. If incomplete, explain what remains.

Review this session for memory-worthy information. If there are new facts, preferences, decisions, or learnings worth persisting, write them to the appropriate memory files:

- User preferences/identity → ~/.claude/memory/user-profile.md
- Communication style → ~/.claude/memory/voice.md
- Tool/environment info → ~/.claude/memory/tool-environment.md
- Project architecture/conventions → .claude/memory/project-context.md
- Architectural decisions (use DEC-NNN format) → .claude/memory/decisions.md
- Tasks/TODOs for next session → .claude/memory/tasks.md

Also write a brief session summary to .claude/memory/sessions/ with filename format YYYY-MM-DD_HHMM.md containing:
- ## Summary (2-3 sentences of what was accomplished)
- ## Key Changes (bullet list of files/features changed)
- ## Open Items (anything left unfinished)
- ## Next Session (one sentence: what to tackle next time)

Rules:
- Do NOT store secrets (API keys, passwords, tokens, private keys)
- Do NOT duplicate entries that already exist in memory files
- Only store genuinely useful information, not trivial details
- If nothing worth remembering happened, skip memory writes entirely
- Append to existing sections with timestamp prefix: - [YYYY-MM-DD] content

Verify the subagent completed its assigned task. Check that the output addresses the original request and contains actionable results. If the subagent failed or returned incomplete results, note what is missing.

Before compacting context, preserve these critical items in your summary:
- Current task objective and progress
- Key decisions made and their rationale
- File paths and line numbers being actively worked on
- Any unresolved errors or blockers
- User preferences expressed during this session
